intro: Rhynchospora glauca var. chinensis, commonly known as the Chinese bluegrass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to East Asia. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered inflorescences with pale blue or greenish flowers. It typically grows in wet or moist environments such as marshes and wet meadows. Its botanical characteristics make it an important species in ecological studies and wetland restoration efforts.
